00:00:11:080000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:11:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:11:080000.Dialogue: I wish you could all be inside my head.

00:00:15:100000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:15:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:19:120000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:19:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:22:020000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:22:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:22:020000.Dialogue: A lichen is an organism made up of two separate species, fungi and algae. If you could merge with another species, what species would you pick and why? Hint: There is a right answer.

00:00:34:200000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:34:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:34:200000.Dialogue: None of you will get it.

00:00:37:200000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:37:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:37:200000.Dialogue: Okay, I'd pick swan because, uh, the resulting hybrid would have the advanced industrial civilization of a human and the long graceful neck I've always dreamed of having.

00:00:49:160000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:49:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:52:090000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:00:52:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:52:090000.Dialogue: Horse, but mostly just for the height. A little bit for the genital girth.

00:01:00:080000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:00:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:00:080000.Dialogue: Wrong, and let's keep it clean, shall we?

00:01:03:220000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:03:220000.Speaker: Howard

00:01:08:110000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:08:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:08:110000.Dialogue: The first of my people to dunk a basketball.

00:01:11:160000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:11:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:11:160000.Dialogue: Also instead of just living in your mother's house, you could actually live inside her body.

00:01:20:030000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:20:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:20:030000.Dialogue: Clever, but also wrong. No, the best organism for human beings to merge with is the lichen itself. That way, you'd be human, fungus, and algae. Triple threat.

00:01:31:070000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:31:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:34:070000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:34:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:34:070000.Dialogue: Give me one circumstance in which that would be useful.

00:01:36:210000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:36:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:36:210000.Dialogue: All right, picture this: a beautiful outdoor concert. Now, as a human, I appreciate Beethoven. As a fungus, I have a terrific view, growing out of a towering maple tree. And no thank you, expensive concessions. Because as an algae, I'll just snack on this sunlight.

00:01:54:070000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:54:070000.Speaker: Raj

00:01:56:210000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:01:56:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:56:210000.Dialogue: Anyway, if it's okay with you, we should talk about Howard's bachelor party.

00:02:01:190000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:01:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:01:190000.Dialogue: Oh, oh. Seems like a bit of a letdown after our lichen conversation, but... What do you know, you're half swan.

00:02:09:160000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:09:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:09:160000.Dialogue: I've been doing some research on strippers. One agency I spoke to, said I could get us a great price if we're flexible on age range and number of limbs.

00:02:18:200000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:18:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:18:200000.Dialogue: Sounds like loads of fun, but I promised Bernadette no strippers.

00:02:23:140000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:23:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:23:140000.Dialogue: You don't want strippers? You're the king of strippers. The one club in North Hollywood named a pole after you.

00:02:29:040000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:29:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:29:040000.Dialogue: What can I tell ya-- I'm not into that stuff anymore.

00:02:32:140000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:32:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:32:140000.Dialogue: Good for you, Howard. I'm proud of you. And still, you're the first one of use to get married. We have to do something special.

00:02:38:020000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:38:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:38:020000.Dialogue: You know Germans have an interesting pre-wedding custom--

00:02:40:220000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:40:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:40:220000.Dialogue: Well, it's probably not for me.

00:02:46:100000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:46:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:46:100000.Dialogue: Maybe we can go up to Napa Valley. They've got that wine train.

00:02:50:020000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:50:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:50:020000.Dialogue: Boo, wine! But yay, trains. I'm in.

00:02:53:220000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:02:53:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:53:220000.Dialogue: Anyway, it's a beautiful time of year. Uh, you travel through the vineyards. There's a tasting on board. And all the wildflowers are in bloom. Magic.

00:03:04:200000.Scene: The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.
00:03:04:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:04:200000.Dialogue: Look at that, in 30 seconds, we went from hiring women to being them.

00:03:40:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:40:070000.Dialogue: So, I hear you and the lost boys are having a bachelor party tonight.

00:03:44:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:44:130000.Dialogue: Yeah, just going to a restaurant, get some steaks, and scotch. Nothing to worry about.

00:03:49:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:49:200000.Dialogue: Well, I don't know. It's a bachelor party. There could be strippers. Wouldn't that make you a little jealous?

00:03:54:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:54:010000.Dialogue: Oh, come on Leonard, it's you. What's going to happen? I mean, even if there was a stripper, all you'd do is avoid eye-contact and maybe offer to help her kid with his homework.

00:04:04:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:04:040000.Dialogue: Hey, I am a young man in his sexual prime. Under the right conditions, I-I-I am capable of just, really crazy stuff.

00:04:12:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:12:210000.Dialogue: Really? What is the craziest thing you've ever done with a woman? And the time you and I had sex in the ocean does not count.

00:04:18:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:18:200000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. That's got to count.

00:04:21:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:21:070000.Dialogue: There was a really strong undertow, we could have died.

00:04:26:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:26:220000.Dialogue: Oh, I will. There is no telling what might happen.

00:04:35:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:35:060000.Dialogue: You know, there's nothing wrong helping some woman's kid get through their S.A.T.'s.

00:04:43:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:43:140000.Dialogue: Hey, I got to hand it to Raj, He found a really nice spot to have a bachelor party.

00:04:47:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:47:140000.Dialogue: It's not bad. Unless you compare it to a train; then it stinks.

00:04:55:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:55:080000.Dialogue: Indeed. If I'm to participate in the social convention that is the stag night, then I must embrace all its components: including tobacco, swear words, and yes, alcohol.

00:05:13:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:13:170000.Dialogue: Whoa, it's a little early to start dropping J-bombs, don't you think?

00:05:20:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:20:160000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, Wil. Nice of you to make it out tonight for Howard.

00:05:23:090000.Speaker: Wil
00:05:23:090000.Dialogue: Well, it was either this or another hot tub party at George Takei's house.

00:05:27:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:27:100000.Dialogue: I'm confused. I thought since our reconciliation, I was your friend in this group.

00:05:32:110000.Speaker: Wil
00:05:32:110000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm friends with Howard too.

00:05:34:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:34:030000.Dialogue: Oh! I guess you're just friends with anybody.

00:05:41:190000.Speaker: Stuart
00:05:41:190000.Dialogue: Hey, uh, Leonard... things are a little tight at the comic book store. I might need some help covering my share of the check.

00:05:52:040000.Speaker: Stuart
00:05:52:040000.Dialogue: And maybe a few bucks for the valet.

00:05:55:000000.Speaker: Stuart
00:05:55:000000.Dialogue: And gas money to get home.

00:06:02:150000.Speaker: Stuart
00:06:02:150000.Dialogue: 18-carat gold, got it in Europe during the war.

00:06:08:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:08:200000.Dialogue: KOOTHRAPPALI: Hey, everybody! The bachelor boy has arrived!

00:06:23:200000.Speaker: Kripke
00:06:23:200000.Dialogue: Yes, yes, yes. He's a jolly good fellow. What time do the strippers arrive?

00:06:28:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:28:160000.Dialogue: Actually, Barry, we're not going to have strippers tonight.

00:06:32:060000.Speaker: Kripke
00:06:32:060000.Dialogue: Ah, then what the frig did I get 200 dollars in singles out for?

00:06:37:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:06:37:170000.Dialogue: You want to buy a watch?

00:06:42:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:42:200000.Dialogue: This is Maid of Honor Amy Farrah Fowler, bringing you the wedding activities just weeks out from the big day. Let's check in with a beautiful, radiant young woman, and her friend who's about to get married.

00:06:57:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:57:120000.Dialogue: Ladies, can you tell us what you're doing?

00:06:59:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:59:190000.Dialogue: Um, these are gift bags we're going to put in the hotel rooms of our out-of-town guests. This is a map of Pasadena. This is a list of local restaurants. And then, for Howie's relatives, we have antihistamines, antacids, and medicine for diarrhea and constipation.

00:07:13:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:13:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, we labeled them stop and go.

00:07:18:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:18:200000.Dialogue: AMY: All right, pivoting to the big question: Bernadette, on your wedding night you'll be consummating your marriage. What do you think your first sexual position will be as husband and wife?

00:07:31:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:31:050000.Dialogue: Keeping in mind that whoever's on top may set the tone for the marriage.

00:07:37:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:37:220000.Dialogue: Hey, they may conceive a child on their wedding night. Don't you think the kid might get a kick out of knowing how it happened?

00:07:44:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:44:100000.Dialogue: I don't care. Ask her things like Are you going to take Howard's name? Not Who's going to sit on who.

00:07:51:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:07:51:170000.Dialogue: I've actually been thinking I'm going to hyphenate: Bernadette Maryann Rostenkowski-Wolowitz.

00:07:57:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:57:190000.Dialogue: Nice. You know, you should totally get Bernadette Maryann Rostenkowski-Wolowitz.com before someone snaps it up.

00:08:05:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:05:220000.Dialogue: Howard already took care of it.

00:08:09:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:08:09:040000.Dialogue: Plus, he set up our beautiful wedding Web site with cute little facts about our family histories. Do you know, for a while in Poland, my family and his family were neighbors.

00:08:19:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:08:19:070000.Dialogue: No, it's not. I'll explain it to you later.

00:08:27:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:27:020000.Dialogue: May I have your attention, please? We are hear tonight to celebrate the upcoming nuptials of my best friend Howard Wolowitz.

00:08:37:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:37:150000.Dialogue: And, apparently, Wil Wheaton's best friend.

00:08:45:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:45:140000.Dialogue: Does anyone have any words they'd like to say about our man of the evening?

00:08:53:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:53:020000.Dialogue: As is the tradition, I have prepared a series of disrespectful jokes which generate humor at Howard's expense. Prepare to have your ribs tickled... Howard... I always thought you'd be the last one of us to ever get married, because you are so short and unappealing. Am I right?

00:09:12:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:12:150000.Dialogue: Let's see here. Oh, seriously though, Howard, you're actually one of the most intelligent people I know. And that's a zinger, because you're not.

00:09:23:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:23:160000.Dialogue: I've always thought that you'd make someone a fine husband someday. Assuming you'd be able to get the parts, and develop the engineering skills to assemble them, which I don't see as likely. Hacha!

00:09:37:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:37:010000.Dialogue: Okay... Let me see here. Okay, kidding aside-- Howard, you are a good friend. And I wish you nothing but happiness. Bazinga, I don't!

00:09:56:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:56:030000.Dialogue: So, Howard Wolowitz tying the knot. Leaving his crazy bachelor days behind. He was a wild one. Well, I guess we all kind of were.

00:10:07:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:07:180000.Dialogue: I remember this one time, I was with this girl at the beach. We were in the ocean and we started making out. I know, it was crazy.

00:10:22:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:22:060000.Dialogue: I wasn't even wearing my Aquasocks.

00:10:26:180000.Speaker: Kripke
00:10:26:180000.Dialogue: Nobody cares, Hofstadter. Wrap it up.

00:10:32:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:32:140000.Dialogue: I totally had sex in the ocean.

00:10:37:000000.Speaker: Stuart
00:10:37:000000.Dialogue: Okay, I'll go. Howard, when I think about you and Bernadette starting this wonderful life together, I can't help but get a little choked up. I mean... look at you. You have everything.

00:10:57:060000.Speaker: Stuart
00:10:57:060000.Dialogue: Look at me. I'm 37. I sleep in the back of a comic book store, and I have the bone density of an 80-year-old man.

00:11:11:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:11:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, to Howard. Yes... Um, uh, who's next?

00:11:14:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:11:14:150000.Dialogue: KRIPKE: I'll go. Howard, I'm gonna say something to you that everybody's thinking but no one has the courage to say out loud.

00:11:25:100000.Speaker: Kripke
00:11:25:100000.Dialogue: When you invite a man to a bachelor party, the implication is, there will be strippers. Maybe not completely nude, but at least pasties and G-strings. That's not unreasonable.

00:11:38:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:38:230000.Dialogue: Okay, uh, anybody else? Huh? No? Okay, it all comes down to me, the best man.

00:11:49:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:49:200000.Dialogue: Ooh! This grasshopper is kicking my ass-hopper.

00:11:53:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:53:120000.Dialogue: Okay, okay, when I first came to this country, I-I didn't know how to behave or how to dress, or what was cool... I was pretty lonely. But then I met Howard, and suddenly, my life changed, because we could be lonely together.

00:12:14:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:14:080000.Dialogue: This man became my whole world.

00:12:24:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:24:080000.Dialogue: I'm not done, but thank you.

00:12:32:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:32:110000.Dialogue: ...to all the good times we had, like, uh, when we went camping and spent that night telling each other all our secrets. I told him I'm addicted to pedicures and he told me he lost his virginity to his cousin.

00:12:50:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:50:230000.Dialogue: And the first woman you ever disappointed sexually. Ba-da-bazinga!

00:12:55:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:55:020000.Dialogue: Oh... oh, yeah, and then there was the time when Leonard and I took Howard to Las Vegas and paid a hooker to pretend she was Jewish and that she wanted his little kosher pickle.

00:13:10:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:10:220000.Dialogue: Of all the Howard humping hookers stories, that one's my favorite!

00:13:15:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:15:050000.Dialogue: Okay, buddy, that's it. Sit down.

00:13:17:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:17:180000.Dialogue: Oh, oh, what about that tubby girl in the Sailor Moon costume at Comic-con?

00:13:26:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:26:060000.Dialogue: The only threesome I've ever had in my life, and I'm proud to say it was with this man right here.

00:13:37:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:37:130000.Dialogue: Oh, oh, don't get me wrong, nothing happened with me and Howard. There was about 200 pounds of Sailor Moon between us.

00:13:48:130000.Speaker: Wil
00:13:48:130000.Dialogue: Oh, Internet, this is so going all over you.

00:14:06:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:06:180000.Dialogue: Thank you for picking us up. There's a warning, right there, on the scotch bottle. You cannot be operatin' heavy machinery after you had a snootful of this, laddie!

00:14:21:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:21:020000.Dialogue: Funny. You boys have a nice time?

00:14:25:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:25:040000.Dialogue: Yeah, it was great. Low-key, like I promised. No hanky-panky, no strippers. Just the guys telling jokes.

00:14:36:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:36:100000.Dialogue: How about you? Did you have a fun night? Yeah, we, uh, made gift bags, had wine, and then went online and saw this.

00:14:45:150000.Speaker: Raj’s voice
00:14:45:150000.Dialogue: KOOTHRAPPALI: Of all the Howard humping hookers stories, that one's my favorite.

00:14:56:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:56:120000.Dialogue: You know, we're not that far from my apartment. If you stop the car, I can walk from here.

00:15:15:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:15:170000.Dialogue: Seriously, you don't even have to stop the car. Anything under ten miles an hour and I can combat-roll into the street.

00:15:25:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:25:070000.Dialogue: Okay, just to set the record straight, I didn't hire the prostitute, she was a gift from him. Shame on you, Raj. That is not how we treat women in this country.

00:15:37:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:37:110000.Dialogue: Don't you try and blame this on him.

00:15:45:010000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:15:45:010000.Dialogue: I don't know what I'm going to do. I'm supposed to marry Howard in a couple weeks and I'm not sure I even know who the man is anymore.

00:15:52:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:52:110000.Dialogue: I'm curious what's bothering you most: the borderline incest, the prostitute or group sex with the girl dressed as the children's cartoon?

00:16:01:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:01:200000.Dialogue: Amy, remember when we went over things that would be helpful and things that wouldn't?

00:16:11:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:11:200000.Dialogue: When I first met Howard, he seemed so innocent to me, just a sweet little guy who lives with his mother.

00:16:16:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:16:190000.Dialogue: Well, if that's what you like, I'll take you to the comic book store-- the place is full of 'em.

00:16:22:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:22:060000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. You set me up with Howard. Did you know about all the creepy stuff he was into?

00:16:30:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:30:040000.Dialogue: Well, a little. You hear stuff...

00:16:37:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:37:020000.Dialogue: Well, I was gonna, but I didn't think it would go past the first date. Then, when it did, I thought for sure it wouldn't go past you meeting his mother. Definitely not past the two of you sleeping together. I mean, the warning signs were there-- this is really on you.

00:16:50:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:16:50:020000.Dialogue: God! I thought you were my friend.

00:16:58:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:58:130000.Dialogue: I don't think that was helpful.

00:17:02:230000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:02:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:02:230000.Dialogue: Hi, Bernie, it's me again. Please call me back.

00:17:07:070000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:07:070000.Speaker: Raj

00:17:09:180000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:09:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:09:180000.Dialogue: It's not your fault, it's mine. I did all that stuff, not you.

00:17:14:100000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:14:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:14:100000.Dialogue: Actually, you did do one of them together.

00:17:18:100000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:18:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:17:20:050000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:20:050000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:21:070000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:21:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:21:070000.Dialogue: You're upset. The convention is to bring an upset person a hot beverage.

00:17:25:000000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:25:000000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:26:150000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:26:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:26:150000.Dialogue: Chicken broth. It seemed culturally appropriate.

00:17:31:050000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:31:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:31:050000.Dialogue: Also, there was a single cube of chicken bouillon in the cupboard when I moved in and it's been bothering me for the last eight years...

00:17:38:020000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:38:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:38:020000.Dialogue: So, as they say, two birds.

00:17:41:220000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:41:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:41:220000.Dialogue: I don't know what my next move is.

00:17:44:110000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:44:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:44:110000.Dialogue: Well, Howard, I don't know much about women...

00:17:47:070000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:47:070000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:53:030000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:53:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:54:200000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:54:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:54:200000.Dialogue: I've got the phone number of the tubby girl from Comic-Con.

00:18:00:020000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:18:00:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:00:020000.Dialogue: I'm not calling the girl from Comic-con.

00:18:02:180000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:18:02:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:02:180000.Dialogue: All right. More Sailor Moon for me.

00:18:08:100000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:18:08:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:08:100000.Dialogue: I just threw up the bachelor party.

00:18:14:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:14:060000.Dialogue: Please come out, Bernadette. Let's talk through this.

00:18:18:200000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:18:200000.Dialogue: Perhaps you should give him a taste of his own medicine. Do you have a cousin who you find attractive?

00:18:27:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:27:160000.Dialogue: Hey, you introduced him to the sleazebag. I'm just trying to clean up your mess.

00:18:36:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:36:050000.Dialogue: I need to talk to Bernadette.

00:18:38:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:38:070000.Dialogue: Well, I don't think she wants to talk to anyone right now.

00:18:41:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:41:150000.Dialogue: All right, well, could you at least give her a message?

00:18:47:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:47:190000.Dialogue: Tell her I'm really sorry. And if she doesn't want to marry me, I get it. But what I really want her to know is the guy that she's disgusted by, is the guy that I'm disgusted by, too. But that guy doesn't exist anymore; he's gone. And the reason is because of her. So, if this relationship is over, let her know that she made me a better man, and tell her thank you.

00:19:29:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:29:170000.Dialogue: That's the most beautiful thing I've ever heard. And it came out of you.

00:19:42:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:42:030000.Dialogue: Penny has a message for you.

00:19:45:090000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:45:090000.Dialogue: I heard. Your voice, not unlike your mother's, travels through walls.

00:19:50:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:50:180000.Dialogue: Do you want me to go?

00:19:53:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:53:060000.Dialogue: No. Come here. I'm still really mad at you.

00:20:05:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:20:05:170000.Dialogue: Is there anything else about your past I should know?

00:20:08:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:08:080000.Dialogue: Couple things, but, you know, most of them happened overseas. I'll tell you later.

00:20:16:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:16:120000.Dialogue: So, is the wedding still on?

00:20:23:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:23:170000.Dialogue: Oh, thank God. I'm still a maid of honor!

00:20:33:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:33:050000.Dialogue: AMY: This is kind of hot.

00:20:45:130000.Scene: The laundry room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown.
00:20:45:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:47:210000.Scene: The laundry room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown.
00:20:47:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:49:170000.Scene: The laundry room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown.
00:20:49:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:49:170000.Dialogue: I'm gonna have sex with you right here, right now, on that washing machine.

00:20:57:050000.Scene: The laundry room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown.
00:20:57:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:59:020000.Scene: The laundry room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown.
00:20:59:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:21:03:140000.Scene: The laundry room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown.
00:21:03:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:21:03:140000.Dialogue: If you want to do something, you can help me fold this sheet.

00:21:08:180000.Scene: The laundry room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown.
00:21:08:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:21:08:180000.Dialogue: Folding a sheet in my underwear, still pretty crazy.
